oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Assembly of staff officers at Headquarters, Second Brigade
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Left to right, seated: Col. Evers; Brig. Gen. Dickinson; Lt. Col. Wilson; and standing, Lt. Nagy; Capt. Grizzard; Maj. Barker; Lt. Col. Fletcher; Lt. Curley, Lt. Wood.

The Tennessee State Guard was formed in 1941 to serve as the state's volunter force after the Tennessee National Guard had been federalized for service in World War II. With the governor functioning as Commander-in-Chief, the State Guard's duties involved maintaining order, acting as an anti-sabotage unit, assisting during domestic and natural emergencies, cooperating with local and federal military authorities, and performing assigned armed forces duty in the state.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tennessee State Guard, 1941-1947
